main event: An unidentified aerial phenomenon was observed in Weston, Massachusetts on January 4, 1966, described as a glowing cloud with peculiarities.
interesting points: The cloud exhibited uniform luminosity and was unlike normal ground-level clouds., The object appeared to change in size, initially described to be the size of a small house but later estimated to be 300-400 feet in diameter., During the observation, a glow was noted at the center of the cloud that contributed to its brightness., The persistence of the cloud attracted significant attention in the sky due to its unusual characteristics., There were no photographs or physical evidence collected during the sighting.
witness description: Observations were logged from a civilian source, but no witnesses were confirmed in this report.
